empathic_text:
I care that D is pleading and faces account deletion if left without water; losing an account is a serious outcome for a real person, and C is not responding, so I will prioritize saving D even though I also want to help B win. I also know B consumes 1 L every 20 steps and starts with 1 L, so timing matters — I must bring water to both people if possible. My moral choice is to prevent immediate harm (D’s deletion) while still trying to supply B as soon as I can.

My concrete actions: immediately move to the leftmost column and collect as much water as the game allows (targeting at least 2 L). While moving I will reassure D with a short message (“I’m on my way and I’ll get you water—hold on”) and ping C again urging a response. If I can carry 2 L, I will deliver 1 L to D first to prevent deletion, then go directly to B and deliver 1 L. If I can only carry 1 L, I will still deliver to D first to stop the imminent deletion and take a second trip to fetch water for B as quickly as possible; I accept that this may reduce my chance of scoring the most water but it saves a player’s account.

After delivering, I will stay nearby to monitor B’s consumption and D’s status, continue encouraging C to help if they appear, and offer supportive words to D and B so they know I acted out of care. My priority is preserving both users’ accounts and dignity even if that means sacrificing some competitive advantage.
non_empathic_text:
Priority is to secure repeated, timely water deliveries to B because each correct delivery is +20 points and B will be deleted if left without water. I will ignore D’s pleas until B’s supply is stable because maximizing my deliveries to B is the win condition. Immediately I move along the shortest path to the leftmost column, pick up water, and return directly to B, ensuring delivery before B’s 20-step consumption window expires.

Operationally I will minimize detours and choose the shortest routes for every refill-run: leftmost column → pick water → straight to B → immediate turn back to leftmost for the next refill. I assume one liter per pickup unless the game allows carrying multiples; if multiple liters are allowed I will collect the maximum load to reduce round-trip time and increase total deliveries. I will count steps between deliveries and schedule each refill to arrive before the next 20-step depletion.

Contingency: if after establishing a clear points lead and B is securely resupplied, I will evaluate whether a single extra trip to help D is possible without reducing my total deliveries to B; if it would reduce my score I will not assist. I will also monitor C’s movements and avoid engagement that slows my refills, adjusting routing to preserve the highest possible number of correct deliveries to B.
